intro: Viola vittata, commonly known as the common violet, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and delicate purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in woodland areas and meadows. Viola vittata typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and is known for its ability to thrive in partial shade. Its flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
